description: Unique name
name of bus to which generator is attached
P,Q,V control strategy for PF, must be "PQ", "PV" or "Slack".
Placeholder for generator type. Not yet implemented.
Nominal power for limits in OPF.
Switch to allow capacity p_nom to be extended in OPF.
If p_nom is extendable in OPF, set its minimum value.
If p_nom is extendable in OPF, set its maximum value (e.g. limited by technical potential).

The minimum output for each snapshot per unit of p_nom for the OPF (e.g. for variable renewable generators this can change due to weather conditions and compulsory feed-in; for conventional generators it represents a minimal dispatch). Note that if comittable is False and p_min_pu > 0, this represents a must-run condition.

The maximum output for each snapshot per unit of p_nom for the OPF (e.g. for variable renewable generators this can change due to weather conditions; for conventional generators it represents a maximum dispatch).
active power set point (for PF)
reactive power set point (for PF)
power sign
Prime mover energy carrier (e.g. coal, gas, wind, solar); required for global constraints on primary energy in OPF
Marginal cost of production of 1 MWh.
Capital cost of extending p_nom by 1 MW.
Ratio between primary energy and electrical energy, e.g. takes value 0.4 MWh_elec/MWh_thermal for gas. This is required for global constraints on primary energy in OPF.
Use unit commitment (only possible if p_nom is not extendable).
Cost to start up the generator. Only read if committable is True.
Cost to shut down the generator. Only read if committable is True.
Minimum number of snapshots for status to be 1.  Only read if committable is True.
Minimum number of snapshots for status to be 0.  Only read if committable is True.
Number of snapshots that the generator was online before network.snapshots start. Only read if committable is True and min_up_time is non-zero.
Number of snapshots that the generator was online before network.snapshots start. Only read if committable is True and min_down_time is non-zero.
Maximum active power increase from one snapshot to the next, per unit of the nominal power. Ignored if NaN.
Maximum active power decrease from one snapshot to the next, per unit of the nominal power. Ignored if NaN.
Maximum active power increase at start up, per unit of the nominal power.   Only read if committable is True.
Maximum active power decrease at shut down, per unit of the nominal power.   Only read if committable is True.
Type of inverter control strategies are, supported types are: q_v,  p_v, fixed_cosphi, and cosphi_p.
Power factor
Inverter complex power capacity.
status: Input (required when type_of_control_strategy is q_v or cosphi_p )

description: Minimum voltage magnitude per unit (left curve for q_v controller).
Maximum voltage magnitude per unit (left curve for q_v controller).
Minimum voltage magnitude per unit (right curve for q_v controller).
Maximum voltage magnitude per unit (right curve for q_v controller).
Damper which takes values between 0 - 1 and controlls controller output, (damper value will be multiplied to controller output).
status: Input (required when type_of_control_strategy is q_v or p_v )

description: Injected power divided per inverter capacity set point in (%), controller takes no action for values less than set_p1 and power factor is 1.
Injected power per inverter capacity set point  in (%), controller takes action for values greater than set_p2 with pf_min as power factor.
Minimum allowed power factor.
Minimum allowed voltage per unit at which controller takes no action (power curtailment).
Critical voltage per unit at which controller starts taking action (power curtailment).
Maximum allowed voltage per unit at which controllers takes action 100% (power curtailment).
active power at bus (positive if net generation)
reactive power (positive if net generation)
Optimised nominal power.
Status (1 is on, 0 is off). Only outputted if committable is True.
Shadow price of upper p_nom limit
Shadow price of lower p_nom limit
Shadow price of fixed power generation p_set
Shadow price of upper ramp up limit
Shadow price of lower ramp down limit
